inventory.commentary: 31aug06 updated to WN 2.1, added features, examples, modified defs. ahouston 31aug06 split sense 1 into sense 1, sense 3. ahouston

sense.name: an available quantity of a resource
sense.commentary: SUPPLY[+quantity][+amount][+available][+resource] an amount of something available for use Note: the modifier specifies the resource, X supply, supply of X
sense.examples: Our supply of toothpaste is running low. Get a free printer with your purchase - while supplies last! (quantity of available printers) Some chemical has contaminated their water supply. John probably has a lifetime supply of paper clips in his desk drawer.

sense.name: act of providing a desired resource
sense.commentary: SUPPLY[+event][+activity][+providing][+resource][+desired] the activity of supplying or offering goods and services
sense.examples: This firm is engaged in the supply of raw materials to the steel industry. Economists study the supply of, and demand for, goods and services in a society. It's an argument from supply side economics. The U.N. has criticized that nation for its supply of arms to terrorist organizations.

sense.name: goods, provisions
sense.commentary: SUPPLY[+entity][+resource][+desired] Note: often occurs in the plural. Note: refers to stuff, not a quantity of something (see Sense 1) Note: often does not have an accompanying modifier, as Sense 1 usually does
sense.examples: Our mini-fridge in the hotel room was stocked with supplies. Each hiker will have to carry their own supplies on their back. Do you need any supplies from the lumber store?
